name: Upright Row, SZ-bar
how_to_perform:
1. Hold the SZ-bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Keeping your back straight and engaging your core, lift the bar out of a downward position to a neutral point alongside your thighs.
3. Keeping your elbows close to your body and avoiding swinging the bar up, focus on squeezing your shoulders blades together to isolate the muscles in your upper back.
4. Hold for a brief moment to maintain tension throughout the range of motion.
5. Slowly return the bar to its starting position, extending through your entire movement to emphasize control and proper form.
short_summary: Upright Row is an isolation exercise primarily targeting the shoulders, traps, and upper back muscles using an SZ-bar.
